description: From Latin fūniculus (“cord”), diminutive from fūnis (“cord”) + -culus.

adjectives.description: funicular (comparative more funicular, superlative most funicular)

entries.meaning: Of, pertaining to, resembling, or powered by a rope or cable
(medicine) Of or pertaining to the umbilical cord.
(botany) Having a fleshy covering of the seed formed from the funiculus, the attachment point of the seed.

A particular type of rail transit system which ascends a steep urban or mountain incline, having usually two cars sharing a single track, with the cars linked by a moving cable and an arrangement of pulleys such that the descending car assists in the hoisting of the ascending car, i.e. the two cars serve as counterweights for each other.
